definition: to pull/to draw (a cart or a bow)/to roll up/to coil/to carry on the arm/to lament the dead/(fig.) to pull against/to recover
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited
to pull strongly against a crazy tide (idiom); fig. to try hard to save a desperate crisis
to rescue a child/Save the Children, a British charity
to push and pull/to move sth forward by shoving and pulling

sentences.english: They walked along with their fingers entwined .
What of the ox who loves his yoke and deems the elk and deer of the forest stray and vagrant things?
sentences.chinese: 對喜歡挽軛，視林中康鹿爲迷途流浪者的公牛呢？

sentences.english: So, I pay attention to take advantage of the hen, hastens to the sleeves rolled up.
sentences.chinese: 於是，我趁母雞不注意，趕忙把袖子挽上去。

sentences.english: With perhaps an older actress holding hands with a little one.
sentences.chinese: 又或許一名年紀老邁的女演員，與一名小演員挽着手。

sentences.english: The Expo emblem looks like three people holding hands。
sentences.chinese: 世博會會徽看起來像三個人手挽着手。

sentences.english: Or what strong hand can hold his swift foot back?
sentences.chinese: 什麼勁手能挽他的捷足回來。

sentences.english: When our breath became short, we strolled, arm-in-arm, through our moonlit yard.
sentences.chinese: 跳累了，便手挽着手在月光照耀下的庭院裏散步。

sentences.english: They are on board leaning over the rail arm in arm.
sentences.chinese: 他倆手挽着手倚在船舷的欄杆上。

sentences.english: A man and woman are walking arm-in-arm.
sentences.chinese: 一對男女手挽着手走着。

sentences.english: As thou goest onwards still will pluck thee back.
sentences.chinese: 在你邁步前進時把你挽回來。

sentences.english: Of course, they still do a lot of arm-in-arm strolling in our day as well.
sentences.chinese: 當然，他們仍然做很多手挽着手漫步在我們的一天。

sentences.english: Their elegiac poems expressed their self-pity and were the products of the given time and society.
sentences.chinese: 文人輓歌詩往往帶有自挽的性質，是特定時代的產物。

sentences.english: Implying that human endeavor could turn back the tides of fate.
sentences.chinese: 言下大有以人力挽迴天命之意。

sentences.english: a mass of French mourners in coats holding hands in 1962;
sentences.chinese: 1962年，許多穿着外套的法國送葬者手挽着手。

sentences.english: Italian men and women may walk arm-in-arm.
sentences.chinese: 意大利男人和女人可能手挽着手走路。

sentences.english: Google Search decline regret and regain market Yusha Parthian shot in China?
sentences.chinese: 谷歌力挽搜索頹勢難捨在華市場欲殺回馬槍？

definition: to gather together/to collect/to approach/to draw near to/to add/to sum up/to comb (hair)
hair worn in a bun or coil
hair rolled up in a bun, topknot
fine black hair/dried plum (sliced, as cake ingredient)
to lead along/to pull (an animal on a tether)/(bound form) to involve/to draw in
mutual respect in marriage/abbr. of idiom 舉案齊眉|举案齐眉[ju3 an4 qi2 mei2]
delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
